alert.note: Alert for North Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN COFFEE...WESTERN GENEVA AND NORTHWESTERN WALTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 AM CST... At 1045 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Lockhart to near Laurel Hill to 8 miles northwest of Baker to 6 miles east of Roeville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Samson, Paxton, Kinston, Coffee Springs, Pond Creek, Perry Store, Gaskin, Lytle, Lucile, Darlington, Marl, Ino, Turner Crossroads, Logan Field Municipal A/P, Goodman, Basin, New Harmony, Enterprise Municipal A/P, Caney Creek, and Gordon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
